summary: This document is a sealed application and order from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, requesting a non-disclosure order for a grand jury subpoena served on Google, Inc. The subpoena seeks extensive records for accounts associated with Ghislaine Maxwell, as part of an ongoing criminal investigation into suspected violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy statutes.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The grand jury subpoena rider explicitly lists her name as the target for which all account records are to be produced by Google, Inc.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: He signs the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying letter to Google, Inc., as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Debra Freeman
persons.context: She signs and issues the § 2705(b) Non-Disclosure Order, sealing the application and prohibiting Google from notifying the subscriber about the subpoena.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is overseeing the grand jury investigation that has issued a subpoena targeting Maxwell's digital records.

events.title: Application for Non-Disclosure Order Filed
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney files a sealed application requesting a court order to prevent Google from notifying the subscriber (Ghislaine Maxwell) about a grand jury subpoena for her account records.

events.title: Non-Disclosure Order Issued
events.description: Magistrate Judge Debra Freeman grants the government's application and issues a sealed order prohibiting Google from disclosing the existence of the subpoena for 180 days.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Served on Google
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office serves a grand jury subpoena on Google, Inc., commanding the production of extensive records for accounts associated with Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands Google to appear before the grand jury on this date, though a personal appearance is waived if records are produced electronically to the FBI.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, New York, NY
Google, Inc., 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043
Federal Bureau of Investigation, 26 Federal Plaza, VCAC/Human Trafficking, New York, NY 10278
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. government obtained a sealed court order in October 2019 to secretly subpoena Google for all records associated with Ghislaine Maxwell, preventing her from being notified for at least 180 days.
The investigation underlying the subpoena was for suspected violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking) and 371 (conspiracy), indicating a focus on federal sex trafficking crimes.
The subpoena sought a vast array of digital records, including subscriber info, payment details, call/SMS records, IP history, and customer service communications linked to Maxwell.
The government argued that disclosure of the subpoena could jeopardize the investigation by allowing targets to flee, tamper with evidence, or intimidate witnesses.
The document shows the covert, methodical steps taken by federal investigators to gather evidence against Maxwell while keeping the investigation secret from her.
